entry.title: PBCO Announces Cash Dividend
entry.summary: February 3, 2026 – PBCO Financial Corporation (OTCPK: “PBCO”), the holding company (Company) of People’s Bank of Commerce (Bank), today announced that it has declared a cash dividend of $0.25 per share, approximately 15% of 2025 net income. The $0.25 dividend will be paid on March 5, 2026, to shareholders of record February 18, 2026.… The post PBCO Announces Cash Dividend appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Pacific Retirement Services Taps Industry Veteran Sloan Bentley as New CEO
entry.summary: MEDFORD, OR – Pacific Retirement Services (PRS), a powerhouse in the non-profit senior living sector, has announced the appointment of Sloan Bentley as its new President and Chief Executive Officer. The move brings a seasoned leader with over 40 years of experience to the helm of the Medford-based organization as it navigates a rapidly evolving… The post Pacific Retirement Services Taps Industry Veteran Sloan Bentley as New CEO appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Five Years in a Row: Sunrise Enterprises Recognized as Best Secondhand Store in Douglas County
entry.summary: Sunrise Enterprises has been named Best Secondhand Store in Douglas County for the fifth year in a row for the 2025 Readers' Choice Award. The recognition reflects decades of community support for a mission focused on inclusion, opportunity, and meaningful employment since 1969.

entry.title: SOU enacts spending restrictions amid cash-flow concerns
entry.summary: (Ashland, Ore.) — Southern Oregon University President Rick Bailey enacted immediate spending restrictions today and asked all faculty and staff members to focus on savings, following an often difficult discussion with the SOU Board of Trustees on Monday about a cash-flow shortage that is expected to exist until downsizing measures adopted as part of last summer’s… The post SOU enacts spending restrictions amid cash-flow concerns appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Some Umpqua National Forest sites move to cashless on April 1
entry.summary: All developed recreation sites operated by the Umpqua National Forest will transition to cashless fee collections through Scan and Pay or reservations on recreation.gov beginning April 1.

entry.title: Some Umpqua National Forest sites move to cashless on April 1
entry.summary: All developed recreation sites operated by the Umpqua National Forest will transition to cashless fee collections through Scan and Pay or reservations on Recreation.gov beginning April 1.

entry.title: Umpqua National Forest Moves to Cashless Fees at Recreation Sites Starting April 1
entry.summary: Umpqua National Forest will switch to cashless fee collection at developed recreation sites beginning April 1, 2026. Visitors will need to use Scan & Pay or Recreation.gov, with cash and checks no longer accepted at Forest Service sites.
